content: how about a pretty and light top made of cheval blanc ambre yarn for the hot days of summer a design signed by andrea yetman for biscotte yarns offered as a free download ♥ ======================================== the pretty in pleats tank has been inspired by one of my favourite knit sweaters it was a sweater that i knit a few years ago but kept reaching for and never wanted to put away for the warmer months knit with cheval blanc s ambre yarn gives this tank a beautiful drape - andrea ---------------------------------------- **yarn** cheval blanc ambre 70% bamboo 30% cotton 105 m/115 yds sample uses 030 - 4 4 5 5 6 6 skeins **needles** main fabric 3 5 us#4 circulars of at least 22 56cm or size needed to obtain gauge ribbing 3 25 us#3 circulars of at least 22 56cm and preferred needles for small circumference knitting **notions** stitch holder or scrap yarn stitch markers tapestry needle **gauge** | 26sts and 32 row = 10 cm 4 using larger needles on stockinette stitch **sizes** | xs s m l xl xxl finished bust circumference 32 34 36 5 40 43 47 inches **pattern notes** the pretty in pleats tank is knit bottom up in the round and then separates at the arm opening and knit back and forth there are extra stitches for the front to accommodate decreasing for the pleats the shoulder straps are binded off using the 3 needle bind off stitches are picked up for the neckline and the arm openings for a more polished look the tank is more roomy around the mid section since there is no waist shaping the sample is knit in size xs 32 and the mid section is still very flowy la version française du patron se trouve sur leslainesbiscotte com 1 1 https //leslainesbiscotte com/products/patron-de-camisole-gratuit-pretty-in-pleats
